transportAdvice: Lagos has a bus rapid transit system and a water ferry network connecting key areas, but traffic congestion is severe and walking is generally impractical outside specific neighborhoods. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available, though visitors should arrange transport through trusted sources and avoid unmarked vehicles.

weather.description: Hot and dry with harmattan haze reducing visibility and bringing dusty air from the Sahara.
Warm and mostly dry, though humidity begins to rise as the harmattan season winds down.
Heat intensifies and early rains begin to arrive, making conditions increasingly humid.
Rainy season gets underway with frequent afternoon downpours and persistently high humidity.
One of the wettest months, with heavy rainfall and occasional flooding in low-lying areas.
Peak rainy season brings overcast skies, frequent heavy showers, and cooler temperatures.
Consistently wet and overcast with the heaviest cumulative rainfall of the year.
Rainfall remains heavy and skies stay grey, though a brief dry spell sometimes occurs mid-month.
Rain continues at a high level as the second peak of the wet season approaches.
Still very wet with frequent storms, though rainfall begins to taper toward month's end.
Rains ease considerably and temperatures rise again as the dry season begins to establish itself.
Dry and warm with returning harmattan conditions, making it one of the more comfortable months to visit.
